ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Nothing toshow..
The reading summary discussion and case study discussions.
Another energy course at Yale! Great chance to get to know Grubler better and understand technology transitions and diffusion in a more systematic, analytical way.
The best part of the course was the presentation of case studies by the students. This was an effective way to learn about energy technology and innovation.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Just additional clarification on specifics of assignments. Also, perhaps trying to stay on time in lectures and tracking students' time presenting.

Our class didn't have as much discussion as some seminars do -- more would have been nice. Of course, that requires the students to step up, not just the professor. Some change in course format might help facilitate getting more people to talk more frequently.

No need for students to present on the readings. Instead of asking students to make long presentations, the instructor should have students give brief summaries of the readings at the beginning of class. Use the saved time to add another technical lecture or two about energy technology and innovation.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Very available and helpful.
Both Arnulf and Jake were always available to help. A bit more guidance on the LSM project would have been nice but otherwise no complaints.

Instructor was very helpful with explaining concepts in and out of class. Instructor went out of his way to mentor students who were interested in the energy field. (This was very much appreciated).TA was always available to answer questions as well.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Focusing on energy issues, so given the dearth of classes at FES, you sort of have to take this one. More broadly, its helpful to gain a more realistic perspective on what to expect in terms of transitioning to the next generation of energy technologies.

This class terrifically fit into my program as an energy student at Yale. It provided an insightful history to energy technology and innovation, and also served as primer for students to conduct further research with regards to energy technology and innovation.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Interested in the topics and working with the instructor. Also, interested in working with classments with similar career objectives.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes
Yes -- would have liked a bit more discussion though.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantage was to bounce ideas off each other and reduce the individual workload.
It would have been miserable to do the LSM project alone. No disadvantages there.
N/A

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Course has goodamount of work but is manageable and worth it. Will stimulate big picture thinking.
Come prepared with the readings and be ready to contribute to the discussion -- if people talk the class can be really interesting.
